title: Date of Scrapbook, Favorite Flower and Color
description: May 25, 1922. Ardath's favorite flower was the Sweet Pea and her favorite colors were Old Rose and Silver.
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Class Yell and Motto
description: Meridian High School's class YELL! "When you're up, your up" and inspiring class motto.
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

description: Ardath Caldwell dressed in her finery. Meridian High School class of 1922.

title: Portraits of Ardath's Classmates (Set 4)

title: Portrait of Ardath's Classmates (Set 6)
description: Single image of Ardath's classmate. Signed "Addie Jane Powell, 22".

title: Pencil Drawing of Ardath
description: Cute pencil drawing (self portrait?) of Ardath carrying stack of books. Nice poem by Vida Thornburg, MHS, 22.
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Poems and Quotes from Classmates (Set 1)
description:
Several poems and quotes from Ardath's classmates. One reads
"Precious book of charming grace,
Gems of thought may here be cast.
Names that time may not erase, Pleasant mementoes of the past.", Ruth Helene Trabert, 22.
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Poems and Quotes from Classmates (Set 2)
description:
Several poems and quotes from Ardath's classmates. One reads
"May thy path be strewn with flowers,
May each day bring golden bowers,
May no trouble dim thy sky,
Only silver clouds float by.", Vera Marjorie Klink, 22.
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Poems and Quotes from Classmates (Set 3)
description:
Several poems and quotes from Ardath's classmates. One reads
"For the structure that we raise,
Time is with materials filled;
Our todays and yesterdays,
Are the blocks with which we build.", Bernice Louise Harms, 22.
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Poems and Quotes from Classmates (Set 4)
description:
Several poems and quotes from Ardath's classmates. One reads
"When you're sailing down life's river,
In your little birch canoe,
I wish you a pleasant journey,
With just room enough for two.", Your Friend, Helen May Normau.
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Poems and Quotes from Classmates (Set 5)
description:
Two poems and two quotes from Ardath's classmates. One reads
"Russel O. Alger "Russ" '22. Always remember "Stude"
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Poems and Quotes from Classmates (Set 6)
description:
Several poems and quotes from Ardath's classmates. One reads
"Remember - All that glitters is not gold. Let us find happiness through seeking to bestow it upon others." Jemima (Fern Scott)
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Poems and Quotes from Classmates (Set 7)
description:
Several more poems and quotes. One reads
"When you are thinking, think of me." Lee Marcund ("Mark")
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Poems and Quotes from Classmates (Set 8)
description: Final page of quotes and a single male (unnamed) portrait.
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Single (unnamed) Classmate
description: Image of a single, female classmate.
subject: scrapbooks

title: Teachers Page (Set 1)
description: Signature from a single teacher, Geo. W. Gould.

title: Teachers Page (Set 2)
description: Several quotes from Ardath's various teachers, including one from Hazel Willett. Hazel Willett and her family are featured in another project in the MLD Collection.

title: Teachers Page (Set 3)
description:
More teacher signatures. One reads: Addie B. Carthrae, Montgomery, MO.
"He who reigns within himself is more than a king". --Milton
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Teachers Page (Set 4)
description:
Final page of teacher signatures. One reads: Hazel McKern, Meridian - 4/4/1922.
"Could anything be sadder than work left unfinished? Yes; work ever begun. -- Christina Rossetti."
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: Images of Meridian High School Teachers
description: Images cut from photos.

title: "Her Invitations"
description: The next several pages contain party invites
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: "Come to My Party"
description:
"Come to my birthday party, July 29.
Come at three, at six we'll dine.
We'll laugh and play,
and have a good time.
For never again,
Will I be nine."
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

title: More Invitations
description: Four more party/dance invitations.
subject: scrapbooks

title: "My Aunt's Heiress" Play Program
description: Class play synopsis. Play was titled "My Aunt's Heiress - A Comedy" and starred several of the Class of 1922 graduates. Ardath Caldwell held the starring role of Mrs. John Smith.
subject: scrapbooks
source: Meridian Library History Center, FC1. Early Days display case.

description: More play and chorus performances in which Ardath Caldwell took part.

title: Miscellaneous Cards (Set 4)

title: Miscellaneous Cards (Set 5)
